results.title: Molecules in outer space
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Radio astronomers scan the skies with the giant Parkes radio telescope in search of radio signals from molecules. They are looking for evidence pointing to the existence of life in space or to the conditions under which life forms could develop.

results.title: Molecules at work (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Laws of Disorder Series”.
Shows that most of the energy that is used by man is derived from chemical re-actions. Illustrates how chemical energy is converted to heat and how the heat is converted into work as efficiently as possible. Professor Sir George Porter is the lecturer and author of the series.

results.title: Molecules and life
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Anvil Films
results.brief_description: Outlines achievements in molecular biology which have revolutionised our understanding of the chemical and physical basis of life. Includes the structure of large organic molecules such as insulin, haemoglobin, myoglobin and vitamin B12, the joining together of amino acids, the complexity of proteins, x-ray crystallography, and clinical applications of scientists’ work.

results.title: Molecular motions
results.creator_credit: Hal Geer and National Science Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Uses animation and models to explain how the properties of matter such as fluidity, vaporisation and rate of chemical reactions depend on the types of motion occurring at the molecular level.

results.title: Molecular biology
results.creator_credit: Bruce J. Russell and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Biological sciences”.
An examination of the DNA based molecular control system. Investigates the primordial origins of DNA, the master molecule of life, and the structure of proteins, fats and carbohydrates. Also discusses current theories of how DNA is organised into chromosomes which store and transmit vast amounts of genetic information. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels

results.title: Molds and how they grow
results.brief_description: Laboratory demonstrations show the effects of moisture and temperature on the growth of moulds. Photomicrography reveals the structure of moulds hyphae, mycelium, sporeballs, spores. Beginning with spores on a rice culture, timelapse photography shows the formation of a new colony.

results.title: Mojo working: Jimi Hendrix 1942-1970
results.creator_credit: Mark Neale, Alan Douglas, Christopher Mould, Screen Ventures, Initial (GB) and Gravity
results.brief_description: Part of the television documentary series “The Making of modern music”. Features live performance footage of Jimi Hendrix and personal commentary by various musicians, writers and critics in the music industry including Keith Le Blanc, Jaz Coleman, P.P. Arnold, Afrika Bambaata, Melanie Williams, John “Rhino” Edwards (Status Quo) and others. Songs include Purple haze, Johnny B Goode, Red house, The Wind cries Mary, Voodoo Chile, Wild thing. “Mojo working” is made up edited excerpts from original films by D.A. Pennebaker, Peter Neal, Peter Pilafian, Jean Peller/John Seay.

results.title: Moi universiteti = My universities
results.brief_description:
In the third part of Donskoi’s Gorky trilogy Alexei (Gorky) as a young man struggles to survive in the city of Kazan first as a stevedore and then as a labourer in a bakery where he cannot accept the simple fact of exploiter and exploited. Alexei experiences a crisis in his life from which he emerges with greater maturity. Also available on 16mm. Part 1 (The Childhood of Maxim Gorki) and Part 2 (My Apprenticeship) of the trilogy available on 16mm, 35mm and VHS. ‘The Gorky Trilogy’ is also available as one title on VHS.

Credits: Director, writer, Mark Donskoi ; photography, Piotr Ermolov ; music, Lev Schwartz.
Cast: N. Valbert, S. Kayukov.
